sunlight: Full sun only if soil kept moist
description: Boxwood (Buxus sempervirens 'Aurea Pendula') is an amazing evergreen specimen, making it an ideal choice for a low-growing hedge. Its small abundant golden-yellow leaves provide tremendous winter interest and liven up shaded areas of the garden. Despite its delicate appearance, boxwood is surprisingly tough and can tolerate a wide range of soils and temperature shifts. It makes a great drought-tolerant ground cover as it slowly grows outward, and can be pruned into an outstanding topiary if regularly maintained. Boxwood's beauty extends beyond ornamental uses and can also be used as a windbreaker and can provide essential nesting habitat for birds.
